newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lagardere's Thomson bond issue fully placed-source.
newsitem.headline: Lagardere's Thomson bond issue fully placed-source.

text.p: Lagardere's five billion franc ($868.5 million) convertible bond issue, part of its financing of its bid in the privatisation of Thomson-CSF has been fully placed with investors, broker Cholet-Dupont said on Tuesday.
Cholet-Dupont was confirming information obtained from several fund managers which showed that the issue was fully subscribed on Friday, two days after it was announced.

British Aerospace took 1.5 billion francs -- as planned, institutional investors in Britain subscribed to 800 million francs, Swiss investors took about 100 million and other European institutionals subscribed to another 100 million.
French insurance companies and retirement funds subscribed to the remaining 2.5 billion francs.
On May 7, British Aerospace said it was putting up 300 million stg ($486.4 million) to support Lagardere's bid.
About 30 investors subscribed to the issue, the sources said.

Since the bonds will be issued only if Lagardere's wins the right to buy the government's 58-percent stake in Thomson-CSF, the subscriptions were made in the form of irrevocable promises to subscribe if Lagardere succeeds, the sources said.
The bonds carry rights to convert to Thomson-CSF stock priced of 165 francs per share.
The bonds will be issued on the day Lagardere is officially designated as the winning bidder, over rival Alcatel Alsthom, which is mounting a joint bid with Dassault Industries.
The government has said it will make its decision after the two-round parliamentary election, set for May 25 and June 1, and before June 30.

The one year bonds will be issued on the eurofranc market and will be repayable in Thomson-CSF shares or cash, depending on the conditions of the planned merger of Matra Hautes Technologies with Thomson-CSF. That merger will follow acquisition of the government's controlling interest.
The yield on the bonds will be PIBOR plus 50 basis points.
